intro: Chionochloa cheesemanii, commonly known as the alpine hairgrass, is a perennial grass native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its fine, silver-gray foliage that reflects light, giving it a distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. It has a tufted growth habit with dense, wiry leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions. Chionochloa cheesemanii plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
